name: Henry Miller
bio: American writer, expatriated in Paris at his flourishing.

name: Anais Nin
bio: American diarist, essayist, novelist, and writer of short stories and erotica

name: Sylvia Plath
bio: American poet, novelist, and short-story writer.

name: Earnest Hemingway
bio: American novelist, short story writer, and journalist.

name: Mary Shelley
bio: English writer who is, perhaps, equally-famously remembered as the wife of Romantic poet Percy Bysshe Shelley and as the author of Frankenstein, or The Modern Prometheus.

name: Virginia Woolf
bio: English writer, who is considered one of the foremost modernist authors of the 20th century and a pioneer in the use of stream of consciousness as a narrative device.

name: Gertrude Stein
bio: American novelist, poet, playwright, and art collector.

name: Jack Kerouac
bio: American novelist and poet of French-Canadian descent.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
bio: American writer, whose works illustrate the Jazz Age. Wrote The Great Gatsby
